title: Mobile-friendly Valentine page with playful Yes/No interaction for Mr. Bingus

requirements.text: Create a single, mobile-friendly interactive page whose only purpose is to ask: "Mr. Bingus, will you be my Valentine?" and present exactly two options: "Yes" and "No".

quotes:
Create a mobile friendly interactive webpage for my boyfriend... to ask him mr.bingus to be my valentine.
There should be two options yes or no

acceptanceCriteria: On initial load, the page shows the question "Mr. Bingus, will you be my Valentine?".
Exactly two actionable buttons are visible: "Yes" and "No".
Layout is usable on common iOS mobile browser sizes (no horizontal scrolling; tap targets are comfortably sized).

requirements.text: Implement the "No" button behavior so it evades interaction: when the user attempts to click/tap it, the button should move away to a new on-screen position, and multiple 'ü•∫' emojis should pop up around the screen to make clicking "No" effectively impossible.

quotes: When he clicks on no, it should move away with ‚Äòü•∫‚Äô emoji popping up all around the screen so that he cannot click on it, forcing him to click on yes

acceptanceCriteria: Attempting to tap/click the "No" button causes it to move to a different position within the visible viewport (not off-screen).
Each "No" attempt spawns multiple visible 'ü•∫' emojis at varied positions around the screen.
The "No" button continues to evade repeated attempts (not a one-time move).
The interaction works with touch input (iOS Safari) as well as mouse input.

requirements.text: Implement the "Yes" flow: when the user clicks/taps "Yes", replace the question/options with a success view that displays a cute meme image and the exact text: "aww good choice ü•∞".

quotes: When he clicks yes show him an cute meme image telling him ‚Äúaww good choice ü•∞‚Äù

acceptanceCriteria: Tapping/clicking "Yes" transitions to a new view/state that hides the "Yes"/"No" buttons.
The success view displays the meme image (bundled as a static asset) and the exact caption text: "aww good choice ü•∞".
The success view is centered and mobile-friendly (image scales responsively without overflowing).

requirements.text: Apply a consistent romantic Valentine theme using a pink/white/red color scheme with a coherent, simple visual style suitable for a single-purpose romantic prompt (e.g., a Valentine card look with hearts/paper textures), and ensure all interactions/animations feel playful but not distracting.

quotes: The page should be themed romantically with pink, white and red colour scheme

acceptanceCriteria: Primary UI colors are pink/white/red (no default/unstyled template look).
Typography and spacing feel like a simple Valentine card (clear hierarchy: prompt > buttons).
Animations (No-button evade + emoji pops) match the theme and do not cause severe layout jank on mobile.

requirements.text: Add the required generated image(s) to the frontend as static assets under `frontend/public/assets/generated/` and reference them directly from the UI (do not serve images via the backend).

quotes: show him an cute meme image

acceptanceCriteria: The UI loads the image(s) via a static path and displays them in the "Yes" success view.
No backend endpoints are added/required to fetch or generate the image at runtime.

constraints: Use English for any user-facing text.
Frontend must remain mobile-friendly and work in iOS mobile browsers.
Do not edit files under `frontend/src/components/ui` or other immutable paths listed in SYSTEM_CONTEXT.
No third-party auth or external services.
nonGoals: Adding additional pages, navigation, accounts, or user profiles.
Implementing a backend canister feature (this experience can be fully client-side).

required: Cute Valentine-themed meme-style illustration with the caption text ‚Äúaww good choice ü•∞‚Äù integrated, romantic pink/red/white palette (valentine-yes-meme.dim_1024x1024.png)
